results.title: Houseboat
results.creator_credit: Melville Shavelson, Jack Rose and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Poor little rich-girl ends up being the governess to a widower and his three children aboard an old houseboat. Sophia Loren and Cary Grant steam up the screen in this classic romantic comedy, complete with luscious colour and ‘VistaVision’ widescreen presentation from 1950s cinema. Resplendent in divine gowns designed by Edith Head, Sophia Loren learns about life and love with a few song and dance routines along the way. The three lead children are also delightful in this witty and entertaining film. Cast includes Martha Hyer and Harry Guardino. Winner of two Academy Awards for Best Song and Best Screenplay, written by Melville Shavelson and Jack Rose.

results.title: Goodbye Lenin
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Becker, Stefan Arndt, Arte, GmbH and X-Filme Creative Pool
results.brief_description: Political satire set in East Berlin circa 1990 “Goodbye Lenin” is a surprisingly light-hearted examination of life under Communist rule seen through the prism of one family. Just prior to the fall of the Berlin wall single mother Christiane falls into a coma, oblivious to the revolution of her beloved homeland. Fearing the shock of the uprising may hamper his mother’s recovery, twenty-something Alex sets up an elaborate ruse in which he convinces her that the East has triumphed over the West. Working from this absurd premise director Wolfgang Becker deftly crafts a poignant and bittersweet work that at heart is a coming of age journey for Alex. Cast includes: Daniel Bruhl.

results.title: The Naked kiss
results.creator_credit: Samuel Fuller, Sam Firks, Leon Fromkess and Allied Artists Pictures
results.brief_description: Written, produced and directed by Samuel Fuller “The Naked Kiss” is a low-budget, tabloid melodrama. Its main character, a prostitute, wants to change her ways and ends up working in a hospital helping the handicapped. This moralistic and exploitative film is a unique look at outcasts showing the harsh realities that exist behind a seemingly civilized society. Outrageous in its time “The Naked Kiss” is a strange mixture of the moralistic and the perverse existing in suburbia. Cinematography by Stanley Cortez. Cast include Constance Towers, Anthony Eisley, Michael Dante and Virginia Grey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Samuel Fuller, Sam Firks, Leon Fromkess and Allied Artists Pictures

results.title: I Want to live!
results.creator_credit: Robert Wise, Walter Wanger, Figaro Films and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning performance by actress Susan Hayward in the lead role of Barbara Graham. Based on actual events and letters from Barbara at the time, comes the story of a girl who had spent time in reform school due to a hard youth when becoming a woman moves easily into the seedy underworld of drugs, parties and prostitution. Barbara attempts to go straight but falls back into her old ways when her junkie husband can no longer support her or her baby son. When two acquaintances are charged with murder they blame Barbara but she continues to protest her innocence. Vilified by the press and subject to an all male jury, Barbara Graham is tried and sentenced. The death penalty by gas chamber is her fate and very believably the way her character is transformed from good-time girl to suffering victim is testimony to the strength of Hayward’s performance. Shot in black and white with a driving jazz soundtrack (even an appearance by Gerry Mulligan) with tight direction by Robert Wise providing an overall intense dramatic experience.

results.title: Insomnia (2002)
results.creator_credit: Christopher Nolan, Andrew A Kosove, Broderick Johnson, Edward McDonnell, Paul Junger Witt, Witt Thomas Section Eight Productions and Alcon Entertainment
results.brief_description: A police detective (Al Pacino) wanted for questioning by Internal Affairs flies to Alaska to assist in a murder enquiry. In pursuit of the suspect in deep fog, his partner is shot and the accident leads the murderer (Robin Williams) to blackmail the detective. Due to the Midnight Sun and the stress of the situation he finds himself in, the detective suffers from insomnia which impacts on his judgement in dealing with his partner’s death. An earnest young police detective (Hilary Swank) is thorough in her investigative techniques and discovers the truth. Based on the film “Insomnia” directed by Erik Skjoldbjaerg, this all-star version is just as compelling. Cast includes Martin Donovan, Paul Dooley.

results.title: The Safety of objects
results.creator_credit: Rose Troche, Christine Vachon, Dorothy Berwin, Clear Blue Sky Productions and Renaissance Films
results.brief_description: Four suburban families and four seemingly separate stories about the struggles of daily life. Life that’s messy around the edges - how we deal with our problems and each other when living the suburban life are explored in this film. Consumer society, shopping and personal objects - how important are they when compared with love and family? Written and directed by Rose Troche, based on a book of stories by A.M.Homes. Cast includes Glenn Close, Dermot Mulroney, Jessica Campbell, Patricia Clarkson, Joshua Jackson, Moira Kelly.

results.title: Thunderstruck
results.creator_credit: Darren Ashton, Jodi Matterson, Sony Music Australia, Showtime, Film Finance Corporation Australia and ICON
results.brief_description: Four mates go on the road with a mission - to scatter the ashes of a friend on the grave of Bon Scott, original frontman for rock band AC/DC. Struggling in their own way with adulthood, the lads get the band back together to live out their promise made to each other 12 years ago - that should any of them die they would be buried out West next to Scott. Living out this pact is harder than they think with a lot of obstacles getting in the way on their life-changing journey. Written and directed by Darren Ashton (co-writer Shaun Angus Hall). Cast includes Damon Gameau, Stephen Curry, Ryan Johnson, Callan Mulvey, Sam Worthington.

results.title: Thirteen conversations about one thing = 13 conversations ab
results.creator_credit: Jill Sprecher, Gina Resnick, Beni Atoori, Echo Lake Productions and Stonelock Pictures
results.brief_description: What is happiness? Through the journey of the everyday, five individuals’ lives link in a way that alters their fate or outlook. Karma, hope and fate are explored in this tale set in amongst busy city dwellers all with the need to answer life’s eternal questions of ‘what is life?’, ‘what’s in it for me?’ and even ‘how do I relate to others?’ Co-written and directed by Jill Sprecher. Stellar ensemble cast includes John Turturro, Matthew McConaughey, Clea DuVall, Amy Irving, Tia Texada, Barbara Sukowa, Alan Arkin.

results.title: Morvern Callar
results.creator_credit: Lynne Ramsay, Robyn Slovo, George Faber, Charles Pattinson, BBC Film Unit and Alliance Atlantis
results.brief_description: After the death of her boyfriend a young aimless English woman living in the West of Scotland, assumes the authorship of his unpublished novel and absconds to Spain on a spiritual journey of self-discovery. Silently grieving and struggling to come to terms with his suicide, Morvern is an ambiguous character whose extreme actions belie her gentle, unassuming air. There is something wonderfully maladroit about Samantha Morton’s performance, expertly conveying Morvern’s despair, as she reconciles the calamitous events that subsequently turn to good fortune. The depressing milieu of the Scottish scenes contrast with Morvern’s liberation in sun drenched Spain as she begins to revel in her freedom.

results.title: Lilya 4-ever = Lilya forever [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lukas Moodysson, Lars Jonsson, Zentropa and Memfis
results.brief_description: Lukas Moodyson (Show me love, Together) delivers a bleak and melancholic story of a young Russian girl Lilya (Oksana Akinshina) who is abandoned by her mother (absconding to America with a boyfriend), deceived by her aunt and guardian and then betrayed by a friend who ruins Lilya’s reputation and consequently, her life. By a series of misunderstandings Lilya falls into prostitution and is then duped by an older man into believing a new life awaits her in the West. Once there however Lilya is forced into an array of humiliating and degrading circumstances that drive her to the brink. Set in the former Soviet Union, this is a somewhat desolate tale of dehumanisation, which contrasts starkly to the sunniness and humour of Moodyson’s “Together”, drawing on the grave themes of parent abandonment, child prostitution and human trafficking. Also available on VHS [318953].

description_for_label: Lukas Moodyson (Show me love, Together) delivers a bleak and melancholic story of a young Russian girl Lilya (Oksana Akinshina) who is abandoned by her mother (absconding to America with a boyfriend), deceived by her aunt and guardian and then betrayed by a friend who ruins Lilya’s reputation and consequently, her life. By a series of misunderstandings Lilya falls into prostitution and is then duped by an older man into believing a new life awaits her in the West. Once there however Lilya is forced into an array of humiliating and degrading circumstances that drive her to the brink. Set in the former Soviet Union, this is a somewhat desolate tale of dehumanisation, which contrasts starkly to the sunniness and humour of Moodyson’s “Together”, drawing on the grave themes of parent abandonment, child prostitution and human trafficking. Also available on VHS [318953].
